posts.post_content:
She gives Razia a run for her money.  
But why bit them against ech other when can you use BOTH?  
They work decent toghether actually. Gisela yield Razia that she NOT made of cardboard (duh) and Razia's can actually smack meanies on another side of the board for a whooping six!  
  
Also it's note worthy that her first ability is kinda political in multiplayer, with opponents smacking each other for double damage.  
  
It's nice knowing that with that angel lady and [Slayer's Stronghold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Slayer's Stronghold) (and mabe, mabe other shinies in Return to Ravnica?) Boros can hit a buck once again.

posts.post_content:
Everyone is pointing out the combo with [Kaalia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaalia), but no-one has mentioned another card from the same Commander deck as her that combos great with Gisela. [Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia). Get both on the table and it's "R: Pyrohemia deals 2 damage to each opponent and each creature they control, and no damage to you or your creatures".  
  
Edit: ClowWizardEriol, the damage prevented is rounded up. Rounding up 1/2 a point of damage prevented equals 1 point of damage prevented, thus she prevents all the damage [Pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyrohemia) would deal to you and creatures you control.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
@BorosGeneral   
Though in this case, the lack of double-strike makes her a card WotC is willing to make, and 2x damage first strike is BETTER than double-strike, in my opinion.  
  
And I actually think the second ability is the better one, since it helps buy you time, and, as mentioned before, in multiplayer formats it forces players to think twice about attacking you when you take half and they take double, and instead choose to attack for double on another person preemptively.  
  
Also, I love how she's around the same power level as BS angel, maybe better, and yet there is nowhere **near** the levels of rage that BS got...
posts.html:

Posted By: TrueKitsonga (5/3/2012 8:53:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I've been waiting for this card.  
  
I'm a R/W player, through and through, and this card just makes me happier than I can probably express.  
  
It was depressing to go through Innistrad and Dark Ascension, with their arbitrary decision to focus on ally colored cards and to ignore enemy colored cards. But, this single card manages to make up for all of that.  
  
It's a legendary mythic creature. Effectively the highest tier a creature can exist in, and the first R/W one ever printed. And, it actually pushes the boundaries of just how powerful a creature can be, being a virtual 10/10 first strike flyer for seven mana, which alone would be tremendously powerful but her abilities extend far, far beyond that.  
  
When you throw in the fact that she's a beautiful angel, I'm just so happy that this card exists. It's like I've been rewarded for not giving up hope, which I guess is the core theme of Avacyn Restored.
posts.html:
I've been waiting for this card.

I'm a R/W player, through and through, and this card just makes me happier than I can probably express.

It was depressing to go through Innistrad and Dark Ascension, with their arbitrary decision to focus on ally colored cards and to ignore enemy colored cards. But, this single card manages to make up for all of that.

It's a legendary mythic creature. Effectively the highest tier a creature can exist in, and the first R/W one ever printed. And, it actually pushes the boundaries of just how powerful a creature can be, being a virtual 10/10 first strike flyer for seven mana, which alone would be tremendously powerful but her abilities extend far, far beyond that.

When you throw in the fact that she's a beautiful angel, I'm just so happy that this card exists. It's like I've been rewarded for not giving up hope, which I guess is the core theme of Avacyn Restored.

posts.post_content: Boy, they're really catering to the EDH crowd in this set.
